body_html:
Yeah, good question.

All I can think of is that TH_REAL_IS_DOUBLE may be defined when building CUDA Float, so NUMPY_TYPE_ENUM gets defined to NPY_DOUBLE at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp#L8 and the condition at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp#L231 is true.
I don't have a CUDA machine right now to verify this though.

As soon as the discussion at #2246 is sorted out I'll fix the issue.

All I can think of is that TH_REAL_IS_DOUBLE may be defined when building CUDA Float, so NUMPY_TYPE_ENUM gets defined to NPY_DOUBLE at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp#L8 and the condition at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp#L231 is true.
I don't have a CUDA machine right now to verify this though.
As soon as the discussion at #2246 is sorted out I'll fix the issue.
body:
Yeah, good question.

All I can think of is that `TH_REAL_IS_DOUBLE` may be defined when building CUDA Float, so `NUMPY_TYPE_ENUM` gets defined to `NPY_DOUBLE` at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp#L8 and the condition at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp#L231 is true.
I don't have a CUDA machine right now to verify this though.

As soon as the discussion at #2246 is sorted out I'll fix the issue.
